title: Metro Hospitality Group Announces New Director of Sales and MarketingTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Metro Hospitality Group Announces New Director of Sales and Marketing Published on : Saturday, August 29, 2015
Metro Hospitality Group, based in Sydney, Australia, has announced the appointment of Rachel Pirie as Director of Sales and Marketing. Rachel will oversee all promotional activities for Metro’s national chain of hotels, apartments and resorts throughout Australia and as well as the Paddy Maguire pub in Subiaco, Perth; The Elephant British Pub in Adelaide and the Palace Hotel in Sydney.
Rachel brings over 20 years’ experience including 7 years managing sales and marketing activities for StayWell Hospitality Group’s Park Regis and Leisure Inn properties both domestically and internationally.
In her new role at Metro, Rachel will be responsible for leading and enhancing the direction of the sales and marketing team including across corporate, government, wholesale and inbound sales, digital marketing, public relations and strengthening awareness of the Metro Hotels brand.
“It is an exciting time to join Metro Hospitality Group, with many properties undergoing or having just completed refurbishments Adding to this, Peter Frawley, who was recently appointed as Managing Director at Metro Hotels is driving an exciting portfolio expansion plan,’’ Rachel said. “As Director of Sales and Marketing I look forward to working with the highly experienced Metro team to ensure the group’s ongoing growing success and to build on its brand positioning across all markets,” she said.
Metro Hotels is the public face of Transmetro Corporation, an Australian owned public company listed on the Australian Stock Exchange. The Group currently provides a national accommodation network of properties in key locations and major cities across Australia including Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Gladstone, Perth and its latest addition, Groote Eylandt Lodge in the Northern Territory.
Source:- Metro Hotels
